titles.title: Regional Presidential Primaries Act of 1988

A bill to establish a series of ten Presidential primaries at which the public may express its preference for the nomination of an individual for election to the office of President of the United States.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 4/25/1988--Introduced. Regional Presidential Primaries Act of 1988 - Prohibits any State from conducting a presidential primary election except in accordance with the provisions of this Act. Establishes ten regional primaries to be held in each presidential election year. Sets the dates for such primaries. Requires presidential candidates, in order to be eligible to receive payments from the Presidential Election Campaign Fund, to agree to enter at least one State primary in each of the ten regions and to notify the Federal Election Commission of which primaries the candidate intends to enter.
